ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed skills in my writing, especially concerning comparing one or more pieces of literature. My rhetorical analysis has greatly improved, and I have also learnt many different skills to apply for all types of writing.
I gained a comprehensive knowledge base of the subject matter and feel very confident with the material we covered throughout the course.
I developed a much, much better writing ability, as well as a lot of insight into more philosophical takes on beauty.
I learned a lot about writing and we really went into depth about the topic of beauty!
I learned a greater appreciation for evaluating beauty as I learned new characteristics of beauty and in some cases why there are no universal characteristics

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strengths of this course was the small seminar environment of the class, which really helped me to develop myself. Only having 8 people meant everyone had amply opportunity to contribute to the discussion - something I think to be very valuable.
Perhaps one weakness of the course is not having enough guidance for the final paper and also not submitting draft for feedback for it. I have a general understanding of what to do but it makes me uneasy submitting the final paper without receiving feedback on a draft first.

I really enjoyed the course and personally liked the subject matter of it. I feel that it could be improved by spacing out the essays a little bit more because it was often hard to complete all of them.
I liked the discussions to think further about the readings, but I wish we had more of a mix of reading material!
It was strong all around. It had great readings, great class size, great teacher, etc

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. The course was a lot of fun and I really liked my class environment. The workload was very easily manageable but was still enough to learn a lot from. It definitely helps to improve writing skills so is very helpful to take during the first semester.
Yes i would definitely recommend it because I really liked Professor Jones and found her to be extremely helpful in bettering my writing ability.
Yes! 100% interesting material, interesting topics and lots of free rein in topic choosing.
Yes! I thought it was very interesting and I learned a lot!
I would definitely recommend this course. It was interesting and fun learning about beauty
